title: Does country music recognise its roots?
description: We speak to the most famous African American country music singer about the lack of diversity in the genre.

title: Sports Minister Nigel Adams says football is 'too dependent' on gambling
description: Football has "far too much dependency" on sponsorship from gambling companies, according to the sports minister.

title: US Space Force logo looks like one from Star Trek
description: George Takei, star of the original 1960s Star Trek TV series, is jokingly demanding royalties.

title: FA Cup: Queens Park Rangers 1-2 Sheffield Wednesday highlights
description: Watch highlights as goals from Morgan Fox and Sam Winnall seal Sheffield Wednesday's place in the FA Cup fifth round despite Nakhi Wells' late consolation goal for QPR.

title: Man uses warm coffee to rescue kittens frozen to ground
description: An oil worker in Alberta, Canada, rescued the animals while inspecting wells.

title: Trump impeachment trial: What happened so far
description: As prosecution gives way to defence, we look back at what you might have missed and what to expect.

title: Coronavirus: How is the Chinese city at the centre of the outbreak coping?
description: There has been criticism that authorities were too slow to respond and contain the virus.

title: Met Police to deploy facial recognition cameras
description: Police say the short-term deployments will check watchlists of suspects wanted for serious crimes.

title: Prince Charles calls for 'lasting peace' on Bethlehem visit
description: He says it is his "dearest wish" the future brings "freedom, justice and equality" to Palestinians.

title: Leyton machete attack: Van driver jailed for wounding officer
description: The judge said Muhammad Rodwan had shown "not a shred of remorse" for the attack on PC Stuart Outten.

title: Harry Dunn: Family 'to continue fight' for Anne Sacoolas' extradition
description: Harry Dunn's mother Charlotte Charles says the US refusal to extradite Anne Sacoolas was "expected".

title: China coronavirus: Cases 'highly likely' in the UK
description: So far 14 people have been tested in the UK, with nine awaiting results and five getting the all clear.

title: Brexit: EU leaders sign UK withdrawal deal
description: The deal formally ending UK membership is signed by EU leaders in Brussels.

title: Baby Harry Richford's Margate hospital death 'wholly avoidable'
description: Harry Richford was born in an operating theatre "full of panicking people", an inquest is told.

title: Facebook's Sir Nick Clegg criticised over WhatsApp security
description: Sir Nick Clegg did not acknowledge WhatsApp security flaws in a BBC interview.

title: China coronavirus: Death toll rises as more cities restrict travel
description: At least 10 cities are limiting journeys in and out as officials say 26 people have died so far.

title: Essex lorry deaths: Accused driver 'can be extradited'
description: Eamonn Harrison is facing 39 charges of manslaughter and two charges of conspiracy

title: 'We've had one proper transfer window' - Solskjaer says there is 'no quick fix' for Man Utd
description: Manchester United manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer says there is no "quick fix" to improve his squad.

title: American teenager Gauff stuns Osaka in Melbourne
description: American teenager Coco Gauff stuns defending champion Naomi Osaka 6-3 6-4 to reach the fourth round of the Australian Open.

title: Taylor Swift reveals eating disorder in Netflix documentary
description: The star felt she would "pass out" during shows after developing an unhealthy relationship with food.

title: Rolls-Royce plans mini nuclear reactors by 2029
description: The firm says it plans to build up to 15 of the mini reactors, which can be delivered by a lorry.

title: 'I literally can't do that again. That's unprofessional' - Williams suffers earliest Melbourne defeat since 2006
description: Serena Williams says she made "far too many errors to be a professional athlete" as she was knocked out in the Australian Open third round.

title: MOTDx FA Cup: Jay1 talks five-a-side with James Maddison & takes on Hot Shots
description: Reece Parkinson links up with rapper Jay1 to get hyped for the FA Cup fourth round, and hears about Jay’s five-a-side encounter with fellow Coventry kid James Maddison.

title: The papers: Tests for 'killer virus' in Britain and HS2 report
description: Many of Friday's newspapers focus on fears that coronavirus has spread from China to the UK.

title: China virus: What's life like in quarantined Wuhan?
description: The city is at the centre of a deadly virus outbreak, and has been sealed off by authorities.

title: Indonesian needlefish boy: 'A fish jumped out the water and stabbed my neck'
description: Muhammad Idul tells the BBC the force threw him from his boat before a desperate race to hospital.

title: Coronavirus: Chinese embassy in Paris finds woman who 'cheated' checks
description: The woman boasted about taking medicine to bring her temperature down in order to clear customs.

title: DNA testing, sperm donor anonymity and me
description: Natasha always knew that she was conceived using a sperm donor, but she also knew that she would never be able to find out his identity.

title: Coronavirus: 'I’m terrified… it's way out of control'
description: Lele should be getting ready for Lunar New Year. Instead she doesn't want to leave her house.

title: How Top Gear overcame its 'problem phase'
description: How the BBC Two motoring show turned its fortunes around after a turbulent few years.

title: China coronavirus: The lessons learned from the Sars outbreak
description: Almost two decades after Sars, a new mystery virus puts China back in the global spotlight.

title: Quiz of the week: Do you know Jones's Python characters?
description: Have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

title: What can you use instead of Google and Facebook?
description: More and more companies are promising privacy online and an alternative to the big internet firms.

title: Grayson Perry on his new exhibition and being an 'outsider'
description: The celebrated artist has put together a new exhibition of some of his earliest works.

title: Giant koala sand art captures Australian bushfires emotions
description: Australian artist "Edward" channelled his "raw emotion" about the bushfires into the artwork.

title: What can school strikers learn from protest veterans?
description: Do today's school strikers think protests lead to change and what can they learn from the past?

title: Coronavirus: What are viruses? And how do they spread?
description: Concerns are growing that the recently-detected coronavirus may spread. Dr Rosalind Eggo explains how that can happen.

title: How Italy's far right is hoping to cause a political earthquake
description: Matteo Salvini is hoping to cause a political shock by winning a traditional stronghold of the left.
